translated: By the cessation of that, there is the cessation of the primordial natures.

analyzed: tadā kim upalabhyate
translated: Then what is perceived?

analyzed: guru upadeśa jānīyāt iti
translated: One should know from the teacher's instruction.

analyzed: evam vidhāya idam paribhāsyate
translated: Having thus determined, this is declared.

original: khajjai pijjai ṇa vicintejjai citte paḍihāa /
analyzed: khajjai pijjai na vicintejjai citte
translated: One should not think of eating or drinking, but let the mind rest in the state of bliss.

original: maṇuvāhi re dullakkha hale visarisa joiṇimāa / / iti
analyzed: re dullakkha hale iti
translated: O mind, do not wander, let the body be immersed in the bliss of the Yoginis.

original: yat kiñcit khādayanti pibantītyādi karmma kriyate sa ca yaṃ yaṃ cittena pratibhāsate taṃ taṃ kuryyāt kintu manavāhi na kriyate /
analyzed: yat kiñcid khādayanti pibanti ityādi karmma kriyate sa ca yam yam cittena pratibhāsate tam tam kuryyāt kintu na kriyate
translated: Whatever action is performed, such as eating, drinking, etc., one should do whatever appears to the mind, but it is not done by the mind.

analyzed: kim yukti durlakṣeṇa līnam pūrvavat
translated: What is the use of a difficult-to-understand path of the Yoginis? It is merged as before.

original: visadṛśayoginīmārgastadāśritena sarvaṃ susthaṃ bhavatīti nānyathā / punarāha
analyzed: visadṛśa yoginī mārgaḥ tad āśritena sarvam sustham bhavati iti na anyathā punar āha
translated: The path of the Yoginis is different, and everything becomes well-established by relying on that, not otherwise. Again, it is said:

original: ia divasa ṇisahi aimaṇai tihuaṇa jāsu ṇimāṇa /
analyzed: ia divasa tihuaṇa jāsu
translated: Thus, the day and night are the three worlds created by the mind.

original: so cittasiddhi joiṇi sahajasamvarū jāṇa / / iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: And that is the attainment of the mind, the knowledge of the innate vow of the Yoginis.

original: evaṃ yaḥ divasaṃ jānāti rātriñca abhijñānabhayaṃ tribhuvaṇaṃ yasya nirmmāṇaṃ sa cittasiddhiḥ yoginīsahajasaṃvarajñānaṃ bhavati sākṣāt karoti
analyzed: evam yaḥ divasam jānāti rātrin ca abhijñāna bhayam yasya nirmmāṇam sa citta siddhiḥ yoginī sahaja saṃvara jñānam bhavati sākṣāt karoti
translated: Thus, one who knows the day and night, the three worlds created by his supernormal knowledge, that is the attainment of the mind, the knowledge of the innate vow of the Yoginis, becomes manifest.

analyzed: vā
translated: or🔽🔽

analyzed: evam a jānānām āha
translated: thus, it is said for those who do not know:

original: akkhara vāḍhā saala jagu ṇāhi ṇirakkhara koi /
analyzed: akkhara vāḍhā saala jagu ṇāhi ṇirakkhara koi
translated: The entire world is full of letters, but the unborn is without letters.

original: tāva se akkhara gholiā jāva ṇirakkhara ioi / /
analyzed: tāva se akkhara gholiā jāva ṇirakkhara
translated: As long as there is a syllable, so long is there no syllable.

analyzed: iti akṣateṣu sakala jagat bādhyate
translated: Thus, when the syllables are intact, the entire world is obstructed.

original: idaṃ tvayā idaṃ mayā athavā idaṃ ghaṭaṃ idaṃ paṭaṃ paṇḍitairūktam /
analyzed: idam tvayā idam mayā athavā idam ghaṭam idam paṭam paṇḍitaiḥ ūktam
translated: This is said by the wise: This is done by you, this by me, or This is a pot, this a cloth.

original: yāvajjīvaṃ kriyate na paramārthaṃ na kiñcit sādhyate /
analyzed: yāvajjīvam kriyate na parama artham na kiñcid sādhyate
translated: As long as one lives, nothing is accomplished, nothing is ultimately achieved.

original: nirakṣaraḥ ko'tra vidyate yena buddhatvaṃ sādhyate /
analyzed: nirakṣaraḥ kaḥ utra vidyate yena buddha tvam sādhyate
translated: Who here is without syllables by whom Buddhahood is accomplished?

original: tāvat saivākṣaraṃ gholitaṃ paribhāvanāyā vāgjālaṃ samastamardditam alīkakṛtaṃ yāvat nirakṣaratvaṃ yāti /🔽naiva kṛtaṃ yāvat kiṃ paramapadaṃ prāpnoti tadāha
analyzed: tāvat sā eva akṣaram gholitam paribhāvanāyāḥ vāc jālam samastam ardditam alīka kṛtam yāvat nirakṣara tvam yāti  na eva kṛtam yāvat kim parama padam prāpnoti tat āha
translated: As long as that very syllable is churned, the entire net of words is crushed and rendered false by contemplation, until it becomes without syllables.🔽It is said:

analyzed: jima vāhira tima avbhantarū
translated: Just as externally, so internally.

analyzed: iti
translated: Remaining in the fourteen worlds, uninterrupted.

analyzed: yoga indrāṇām yādṛśam bāhyam tādṛśam abhyantaram
translated: For the lords of yoga, what is external is the same internally.

analyzed: kim tarhi jñāna ākāra tvāt
translated: What then? Because of the form of knowledge.

analyzed: taiḥ caturddaśa bhuvaneṣu nirantara avaragreṇa sthitam parama kalā bhāvāt
translated: And by them, remaining in the fourteen worlds with uninterrupted upward movement, due to the absence of the highest energy.

original: sa ca yogī amāvāsyāntena candrakalāmivāśarīratvāt / tenāha
analyzed: sa ca yogī amāvāsyā antena candra kalām iva aśarīra tvāt tena āha
translated: And that yogi, like the digit of the moon at the end of the new moon, due to being bodiless, therefore it is said:

original: asarira koi sarīrahi lukko /🔽jo tahi jāṇai so tahi mukko / / iti /
analyzed: asarira koi  jaḥ tahi jāṇai saḥ tahi mukkaḥ iti
translated: Someone without a body is hidden within the body.🔽He who knows that is liberated within that.

original: aśarīraṃ sattve sākṣādastamitaṃ bhavati lukko sa yena jñānaṃ sa tasmin mukkobhavati /
analyzed: aśarīram sattve sākṣāt astamitam bhavati lukkaḥ sa yena jñānam sa tasmin mukkobhavati
translated: The bodiless being becomes directly absorbed in the embodied one, hidden. He by whom there is knowledge of that becomes liberated within that.

analyzed: kutas yatas pratyātma vedakaḥ lokaḥ
translated: Why? Because the world experiences each for itself.

analyzed: vedyam ca ādau eva na utpanna śarīra tvāt
translated: And the object of experience does not arise at the beginning because the body has not yet been produced.

analyzed: nirākāra jñānam etat
translated: This knowledge is formless.

analyzed: tasya saṃjñā sukha pravṛttiḥ
translated: Its designation is the occurrence of pleasure.

analyzed: tat amṛtam sahajam iti
translated: That is immortality, innate.

original: purūṣapudgalānā sahajāt pūrvotpādavināśakāle tatraiva līnaḥ sukhasya sthitiḥ nāsti asthānatvāt /
analyzed: sahajāt pūrva utpāda vināśa kāle tatra eva līnaḥ sukhasya sthitiḥ na asti asthāna tvāt
translated: For the person, the individual, at the time of the innate prior arising and destruction, there is no abiding of pleasure there, because it is non-abiding.

original: tasmāt purvabhāvaṃ nirākāraṃ jñānaṃ tasyaiva dharmmadhāturiti ādisaṃjñā /
analyzed: tasmāt purva bhāvam nirākāram jñānam tasya eva dharmmadhātuḥ iti ādi saṃjñā
translated: Therefore, the formless knowledge of prior existence is designated as the beginning of that very dharma-realm.

original: evaṃ yo jānāti gurūpadeśāt sa ihaiva janmani anenaiva śarīreṇa mukto bhavati nānyatheti /
analyzed: evam yaḥ jānāti guru upadeśāt saḥ iha eva janmani anena eva śarīreṇa muktaḥ bhavati na anyathā iti
translated: Thus, he who knows this from the teacher's instruction becomes liberated in this very life with this very body, not otherwise.

original: anenokte sati granthakārasya tatpariṇāmatayā spararastu na paśyati tenedamudīrayannāha
analyzed: anena ukte sati granthakārasya tad pariṇāma tayā spararaḥ tu na paśyati tena idam udīrayan āha
translated: When this is stated, let the author of the treatise be content with its transformation, he does not see it. Therefore, uttering this, he says:

analyzed: mai paḍhame
translated: May there be success! I have studied the first part.

original: maṇḍa pivante visaraa e maiu / /🔽akkharamekka ettha mai jāṇiu /
analyzed: maṇḍa pivante visaraa  ettha mai
translated: They drink the essence, leaving the husk.🔽Here, know only one syllable.

original: tāhara ṇāma ṇa jāṇami e saiu / / iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: I do not know this name, it is said.

original: yathā bālatve tvādāvevākṣaraśikṣaṇāyopādhyāyasyāgre phalakeṣu siddhirastu ityādinā yāvatsūtradhātvādivyākaraṇaparyyantaṃ tarkamīmāṃsādi sarva
analyzed: yathā bāla tve tu ādau eva akṣara śikṣaṇāya upādhyāyasya agre phalakeṣu siddhiḥ astu ityādinā yāvat sūtra dhātu ādi vyākaraṇa paryyantam tarka mīmāṃsā ādi
translated: Just as in childhood, in the beginning itself, for the sake of learning syllables, in front of the teacher, may there be success on the slates, etc., up to the grammar of sutras, dhatus, etc., all

original: paṭhitaṃ tadā sarvākṣareṣu na kiñcit phalaṃ dṛṣṭamajñānatvāt /
analyzed: paṭhitam tadā sarva akṣareṣu na kiñcid phalam dṛṣṭam ajñāna tvāt
translated: having been studied, then no fruit is seen in all the syllables, because of ignorance.

original: punarapi sukalyāṇamitrārādhanāyāṃ satyāṃ parijñānena vicāritaṃ yaḥ prathamaṃ vākyaṃ siddhirastvīti sa satyaṃ tatparaṃ yat mayā paṭhitamanyākṣaramasāram
analyzed: punar api su kalyāṇa mitra ārādhanāyām satyām parijñānena vicāritam yaḥ prathamam vākyam siddhiḥ astu iti sa satyam tat param yat mayā paṭhitam anya akṣaram asāram
translated: Again, when there is the propitiation of a very good spiritual friend, having been considered by perfect knowledge, the first statement May there be success is true, that which I have read, other syllables are worthless.

original: yathā bhaktarandhanāyāṃ sāraṃ gṛhītaṃ khaṇḍaṃ samayī pīttvā śeṣamasāramaṇḍameva sāraṃ taṃ pītvānyaṃ vismṛtaṃ gṛhītaḥ siddhirastviti /
analyzed: yathā bhakta randhanāyām sāram gṛhītam khaṇḍam samayī pīttvā śeṣam asāram aṇḍam eva sāram tam pītvā anyam vismṛtam gṛhītaḥ siddhiḥ astu iti
translated: Just as in cooking rice, having taken the essence, the lump, the initiate having drunk, the rest, the worthless essence itself, having drunk that, another is forgotten, May there be success.

analyzed: etat eva akṣaram ekam pūrva ukta jñānam iha mayā jñātam
translated: This very one syllable, the knowledge spoken of before, is known by me here.

original: tasmit vāmasya nāmaṃ na jānāmi kīdṛśamiti avācyatvāt nārthaṃ vatti siddhirastu ca /
analyzed: tasmin vāmasya nāmam na jānāmi kīdṛśam iti avācya tvāt na artham vatti siddhiḥ astu ca
translated: I do not know what form the name of that [reality] is, because it is inexpressible. Let there be success in not expressing the meaning.

analyzed: tathā api asau prauḍha tve pi ca
translated: Even so, it is so.

analyzed: na asti nāma varṇa ādi khyātiḥ
translated: There is no manifestation of name, letters, etc.

original: anye kudhiyaḥ na jānanti teṣām āha 🔽rūaṇe saala vi johi ṇau gāhai /🔽kundurū khaṇahi mahāsuhe sāhai / / iti /
analyzed: anye kudhiyaḥ na jānanti teṣām āha  rūaṇe saala vi nau gāhai  kundurū mahā suhe sāhai
translated: Other foolish ones do not know. For them it is said:

original: sahajarūpaṇena sakalatribhuvanapatitaṃ na grāhitaṃ svayaṃbhūjñānākāreṇa ca avācyanāmeva vā /
analyzed: sahaja rūpaṇena sakala tribhuvana patitam na grāhitam svayaṃbhū jñāna ākāreṇa ca avācya nāmā iva vā
translated: In the act of embracing, all the three worlds fall, not grasped by the self-arisen one's knowledge, and by the inexpressible name itself.

original: tadā punarapi svayaṃ naṣṭāḥ parānapi bandhāyanti /
analyzed: tadā punar api svayam naṣṭāḥ parān api bandhāyanti
translated: Then again, they themselves are lost and bind others.

analyzed: kim tat kundu rūkṣaṇeṣu mahā sukham sādhayati iti
translated: What is that? It is the great bliss that is accomplished in the act of embracing.

analyzed: tasmāt te mūrkha dehinaḥ
translated: Therefore, they are embodied fools.

analyzed: punar api āha  dhāvai
translated: Again it is said:🔽As one afflicted with thirst runs to water seen through excessive thirst and blindness,

original: marai so sosahi ṇabhajalu kahi pāvai / /
analyzed: marai saḥ kahi pāvai
translated: he dies there, not finding the water in the mist.

original: yathā tṛṣṇārttaḥ atitṛṣṇayā andhatvena pānīyaṃ dṛṣṭvā dhāvati tadā cakṣuṣā nīhāramātraṃ na pānīyaṃ tadārttatayā sisena mriyate /
analyzed: yathā tṛṣṇā ārttaḥ ati tṛṣṇayā andha tvena pānīyam dṛṣṭvā dhāvati tadā cakṣuṣā nīhāra mātram na pānīyam tad ārtta tayā mriyate
translated: As one afflicted with thirst runs to water seen through excessive thirst and blindness, and then, due to the mere mist in the eyes, not the water, dies through the frost,

original: ākāśajalaṃ kutaḥ prāpyate na prāpyate iti yāvat /
analyzed: ākāśa jalam kutas prāpyate na prāpyate iti yāvat
translated: How can one obtain or not obtain sky-water?

analyzed: evam iva kundurū yogena tattvam na prāpyate
translated: Thus, by the method of Kunderika, reality is not obtained.

original: mūdalokairevaṃ tattvaṃ kva jñeyaṃ kiṃ yuktirvā etadevāha 🔽kandha bhūa āattaṇa indīvisaa viārū apa hua /🔽ṇau ṇau dohācchande ṇa kahavi kimpi goppa / / iti /
analyzed: mūda lokaiḥ evam tattvam kva jñeyam kim yuktiḥ vā etat eva āha  indīvisaa viārū apa hua  iti
translated: By ordinary people, how can reality be known? What is the reasoning? He says this

analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatana indriya viṣaya vikalpa vibhrama rūpam paśyati
translated: The form of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, faculties, and objects is seen as confused.

original: yatra lakṣyaṃ lakṣaṇañca na vidyate teṣu sarvathā marīcijalavadviśvamudakasaṃjñā pratīyate /
analyzed: yatra lakṣyam lakṣaṇam ca na vidyate teṣu sarvathā marīci jala vat viśvam udaka saṃjñā pratīyate
translated: Where there is no object and characteristics, in all ways the world is perceived as water, like water in a mirage.

analyzed: udaka bhāvaḥ ca na asti eva marīci ābhāsa saṃjñayā
translated: And the state of water does not exist at all, by the perception of the appearance of a mirage.

analyzed: marīci bhrāntim eva hi udakasya ābhāsam pratīyate iti
translated: For the appearance of water is perceived as the appearance of a mirage.

analyzed: tasmāt nava nava anya anya dohā śabdena tattvam darśitam
translated: Therefore, the truth is shown by the word doha as new and new.

original: tasmin dohāmadhye kasmin doheṣu kiñcit guptaṃ na kṛtaṃ gurūpadeśaṃ na vināśitaṃ syāditi /
analyzed: tasmin dohā madhye kasmin doheṣu kiñcid guptam na kṛtam guru upadeśam na vināśitam syāt iti
translated: In the midst of those dohas, in which dohas is nothing hidden not done, not destroyed without the teacher's instruction?

analyzed: etad artha sarveṣām paṇḍitānām kṣamāpayati iti āha
translated: For this purpose, he asks for forgiveness from all the wise ones, saying

original: paṇḍia lośrahu khamahu mahu etthu ṇa kiai viappu / /
analyzed: paṇḍia lośrahu khamahu mahu etthu ṇa kiai
translated: O wise people, I have spoken this knowledge, both secret and not secret, as if it were not concealed at all.

original: jo gurūvaaṇe mai suau tahi kiṃ kahami sugoppu / / iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: If you are well-versed in the words of the teacher, then why should it be well-guarded? Thus.

original: he paṇḍitaloka īdṛśaṃ jñānaṃ guptāguptaṃ mayā kathitaṃ tathā mama kṣamāṃ karoṣi /
analyzed: he paṇḍita loka īdṛśam jñānam gupta aguptam mayā kathitam tathā mama kṣamām karoṣi
translated: O wise people, I have spoken this kind of knowledge, both secret and not secret, so you should forgive me.

original: kutaḥ / yataḥ suguptasthāne na guptīkṛtaṃ yathā guptasthāne prakāśitaṃ sattvopakāra cetasā tenedaṃ vikalpaṃ na kāryyamevañca sammatam /
analyzed: kutas yatas su gupta sthāne na guptīkṛtam yathā gupta sthāne prakāśitam sattva upakāra cetasā tena idam vikalpam na kāryam evam ca sammatam
translated: Why is that? Because what is well-guarded is not guarded, and what is guarded is revealed in a place of concealment, with a mind to benefit beings. Therefore, this should not be doubted at all. And this is agreed upon.

analyzed: mama ekākinasya na bhavati
translated: It does not belong to me alone.

original: kutaḥ / yataḥ mamāpi svaguroḥ sakāśāt yadvacanamīdṛśaṃ śrutaṃ tat kiṃ karoti suguptaṃ prakaṭañca /
analyzed: kutas yatas mama api sva guroḥ sakāśāt yat vacanam īdṛśam śrutam tat kim karoti su guptam prakaṭam ca
translated: Why is that? Because the words that I have heard from my own teacher, which are of this kind, what does he do with them? He makes them well-guarded and revealed.

analyzed: evam uktena kim syāt
translated: What would be the result of speaking like this?

analyzed: bhavya sattveṣu guptam iti etat eva āha
translated: It is secret among fortunate beings. This is what he says

original: kamalakulisa vevi majjhaṭhiu jo so suraa vilāsa /
analyzed: vevi jaḥ saḥ sura vilāsa
translated: The lotus stalk is chewed by the one who is the sport of the gods.

original: ko ta ramai ṇaha tihuaṇe hi kassa ṇa pūrai āsa / / iti
analyzed: kaḥ ta ramai hi kassa ṇa pūrai āsa   iti
translated: Who is not satisfied by that in the three worlds? Whose desire is not fulfilled? Thus.

original: anenātyantādikarmmikāṇāṃ mṛduyogināṃ vā rāgāsaktānāñca mahārāgakīḍanaiva buddhatvamupāya iti darśitaṃ bhagavatā /
analyzed: anena atyanta ādikarmmikāṇām mṛdu yoginām vā rāga āsaktānām ca mahā rāga kīḍanā eva buddhatvam upāyaḥ iti darśitam bhagavatā
translated: By this, the Blessed One has shown that for those who are extremely beginners or soft yogis who are attached to passion, the play of great passion itself is the means to Buddhahood.

original: tathā iha mayā avatāritaṃ kamalakuliśadvayeṣu yat suratavilāsaṃ ko vīrapurūṣastatra ramate /
analyzed: tathā iha mayā avatāritam kamala kuliśa dvayeṣu yat surata vilāsam kaḥ vīra purūṣaḥ tatra ramate
translated: Thus, I have brought this play of love into the two, the lotus and the thunderbolt. What heroic man delights in that?

original: tena tribhuvane kasya na pūrita āsaḥ /
analyzed: tena tribhuvane kasya na pūritaḥ āsaḥ
translated: By that, whose heart is not filled in the three worlds?

original: sarvveṣāṃ tanmayatvena tatsvabhāvatayā sarvvāsāṃ mahāmudrā siddhiḥ pūritā bhavati /
analyzed: sarvveṣām tad maya tvena tad svabhāva tayā sarvvāsām mahāmudrā siddhiḥ pūritā bhavati
translated: By being full of that and having the nature of that, the accomplishment of all great seals is fulfilled.

analyzed: mahākarūṇāyāḥ ā mukhīkaraṇāt iti niyamaḥ
translated: This is the rule due to the manifestation of great compassion.

analyzed: kintu adhimātra indriyāṇām na īdṛśaḥ
translated: But for those with superior faculties, it is not like this.

original: kiṃ tadāha yadi kamalakuliśena tattvaṃ tadā ātmanā sukhamutpādya parasya sukhānubhavaṃ vinā gate na sarvvatribhuvanasya sā pūritā bhavati
analyzed: kim tat āha yadi kamala kuliśena tattvam tadā ātmanā sukham utpādya parasya sukha anubhavam vinā gate na sarvva tribhuvanasya sā pūritā bhavati
translated: What is that? If the truth is by the lotus and thunderbolt, then having produced bliss for oneself without the experience of bliss for another, it is not fulfilled everywhere in the three worlds.

analyzed: buddha jñānam eva iti
translated: It is only the knowledge of the Buddha.

original: tasmānna tādṛśaṃ buddhajñānaikakṣaṇe abhisambodhiḥ sarvveṣāṃ samanākālatvāt saṃkṣepataḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt na tādṛśam buddha jñāna eka kṣaṇe abhisambodhiḥ sarvveṣām samanā kāla tvāt saṃkṣepataḥ
translated: Therefore, such is not the enlightenment in a single moment of the knowledge of the Buddha, because of the simultaneity of all in brief.

original: khaṇa uvāśra suha ahavā veṇṇi vi sovi /
analyzed: suha ahavā
translated: The moment is said to be either a moment, a muhūrta, or a saṃvatsara.

original: gurūpāa pasāe puṇṇa jai viralā jāṇai kovi / /
analyzed: puṇṇa jai viralā jāṇai
translated: By the grace of the Guru, only a few people know the rare truth.

analyzed: kṣaṇam ca idam sukhasya catur kṣaṇa bhedāt
translated: This moment is of happiness, divided into four moments.

analyzed: athavā abhinne pi kṣaṇe tattvam upalakṣayet
translated: Or, even in an undivided moment, one should understand the truth.

analyzed: sa ca parama viramayoḥ madhye abhinnam eva
translated: And that is undivided between the highest and the lowest.

original: prathamārambhe vicitrādikṣaṇe utpādanāyā'bhinne sahajabhāvaṃ saiva gurūpādaprasādena puṇyavaśāt /

analyzed: tena idam mayā sat guru upadeśena vyaktīkṛtam pūrvva ukta nyāyāt

analyzed: sarva janeṣu sādhāraṇam iti evam ca

analyzed: parama gambhīre tatra na param na ātmanā kiñcid asti

analyzed: ādau eva rahita tvāt

analyzed: sarvva caura caṇḍāla dibhiḥ harati

analyzed: tārā gaṇa nāyakaḥ candraḥ śukraḥ caḥ utthitaḥ bhavati

analyzed: cittena cittam tvam vicārayasi

analyzed: kintu cittam acittam ca asti

analyzed: pūrvva ukta nyāyāt eva dvayoḥ na asti tathā ca āha

analyzed: cittam evā iha na ācitam dvaya abhāvāt na kiñcana

analyzed: na kiñcid nāma vidyeta bhrāntyā sarvvam idam jagat
translated: Nothing whatsoever would exist. Through delusion, this entire world

analyzed: gaaṇa girī tahi taḍa vasai

analyzed: asya idam vikalpam na pṛcchasi

analyzed: kintu prāṇa atipāta ādi ku karmma varjjasi

analyzed: yaiḥ tīrthika ādi
translated: By which, those who go to hell due to being tīrthikas, etc.,

analyzed: kintu advayaḥ api nirmalaḥ pratipannaḥ parama advayam iti bhāvaḥ

translated: Having stood in this or that, having performed walking, eating, etc., you should reflect in the mind that the mind is false, and that the intimation is also false.

analyzed: tat ca pūrve nirākṛtam asiddha tvāt
translated: And that has been refuted earlier because it is unestablished.

analyzed: tasmāt sakala traidhātukeṣu nirantara avyavacchinna pravāhāt
translated: Therefore, from the uninterrupted and undivided stream in the entire three realms,

analyzed: bodhi sthitam siddham
translated: the state of enlightenment is established.

analyzed: na kenacid utpāditam svayambhu tvāt
translated: It is not produced by anyone, because it is self-existent.

original: tadiha kudhībhiḥ mūḍhatvena parikalpitaṃ bhavanirvāṇayoradvayoḥ kenedaṃ na syāt uktanyāyādapi /

analyzed: tasmin nirvāṇam na bhavati

original: kutaḥ / yataḥ ādāveva viśvasyotpādaṃ nāsti tat kimiti dṛśyate /
analyzed: kutas yatas ādau eva viśvasya utpādam na asti tat kim iti dṛśyate

analyzed: māyā vat iti bhrāntyā pratibhāsa mātram eva iti  yathā darpaṇa ādiṣu pratibimbam dṛśyate tad vicārāt na upalabhyate
translated: Like an illusion, it is mere appearance through delusion.🔽Just as a reflection is seen in mirrors, etc., it is not perceived upon examination.

analyzed: tat bimba piṇḍa parimāṇavat tva ādi bhedena asambhavam iti
translated: Because it is impossible due to differences such as having the size and shape of the original object.

analyzed: kasmāt bhava nirvāṇayoḥ asambhavam
translated: Why is it impossible for existence and nirvana?

analyzed: tathā ca uktam
translated: And thus it is said:

analyzed: nirvāṇam ca eva lokan ca manyante tattva darśinaḥ  na evam lokam na nirvāṇam manyante tattva darśinaḥ

analyzed: nirvāṇam ca bhavaḥ ca eva dvayam etat na vidyate
translated: Both worldly existence and nirvāṇa do not exist as a duality.

analyzed: parijñānam bhavasya eva nirvāṇam iti kathyate
translated: The thorough knowledge of worldly existence itself is called nirvāṇa.

analyzed: tasmāt siddham parama advayam bodhi rūpam sa ca āha
translated: Therefore, it is established that supreme non-dual enlightenment is of the nature of consciousness.

original: ṇau ghare ṇau vaṇe vohi ṭhiu ehu pariāṇahu bheu /
analyzed: ṇau ghare ṇau vaṇe ehu pariāṇahu bheu
translated: In the house, in the forest, in the house, in the forest, stand, come, embrace, be.

analyzed: iti
translated: Having the companion of a pure mind, make the enjoyment complete.

original: idam upalakṣaṇāyāṃ na ghare na vaneṣu bodhisthitam /
analyzed: idam upalakṣaṇāyām na ghare na vaneṣu bodhi sthitam
translated: This is in the context of metaphor. Enlightenment does not stand in the house or in the forests.

original: evaṃ bhedaṃ parijānāsi sandhyābhāṣāntare'pi gṛhaṃ śarīraṃ vanaṃ ghaṭapaṭādiṣu tatra na bodhiḥ /
analyzed: evam bhedam parijānāsi sandhyā bhāṣā antare pi gṛham śarīram vanam ghaṭa paṭa ādiṣu tatra na bodhiḥ
translated: Thus, you should know the difference. In the language of the evening, the house is the body, the forest is pots, cloth, etc. Enlightenment is not there.

analyzed: kutas sarve hi asambhavāt
translated: Why? Because all are impossible.

original: evaṃ bhedaṃ yat dṛśyate lokādi tat sarvam utpannavināśinaḥ /

analyzed: na īdṛśī bodhiḥ a vinaṣṭa tvāt ca
translated: Enlightenment is not like that, because it is indestructible.

analyzed: tena iha nirmala citta svabhāva tām kurvati
translated: Therefore, those who make the nature of the mind pure here,

original: yairvikalpanā vikalpasi samastā saṅgatā tyajasīti vistaraḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ vikalpanā vikalpasi samastā saṅga tā tyajasi iti vistaraḥ
translated: by whom all conceptual thoughts are abandoned together, you should give up attachment, and so on in detail.

analyzed: taiḥ bodhi rūpam āyāti tat āha
translated: By them one attains the form of enlightenment, that is said:

original: ehu so appā ehu paru jo paribhāvai kovi /
analyzed: ehu saḥ appā ehu paru jaḥ
translated: Come, that is little, come, the other, which is fully understood.

original: te viṇu vandhe veṭṭhi kiu appa vimukkau tovi / / iti /
analyzed: te viṇu vandhe veṭṭhi kiu appa vimukkau tovi
translated: Without that bondage, one's self is made defective, not liberated at all.

original: idamātmā na idaṃ paraḥ yena kenacidviparibhāvitaṃ tena vinā bandhanena ātmānaṃ viṭakitaṃ vikalīkṛtaṃ mukto'pi svabhāvayātaṃ tadā no muktaḥ
analyzed: idam ātmā naḥ idam paraḥ yena kenacid viparibhāvitam tena vinā bandhanena ātmānam viṭakitam vikalīkṛtam muktaḥ api svabhāva yātam tadā no muktaḥ
translated: This is one's own, this is not another's. By whatever means it is fully understood, without that bondage, one's self is made defective, crippled, even if liberated, then one is not liberated by one's own nature.

original: tasmāt svaparavibhāgaṃ na kriyate iti yāvat / tadiha
analyzed: tasmāt sva para vibhāgam na kriyate iti yāvat tat iha
translated: Therefore, one does not make a distinction between oneself and others, up to that. That is here:

original: para appāṇa ma bhanti karū saala ṇirantara vuddha /
analyzed: para appāṇa ma bhanti karū saala ṇirantara vuddha
translated: Others do not consider themselves as suffering, but as all-pervading, uninterrupted, and increasing.

original: paha se ṇimmala paramapau citta sahāve suddha / / iti /
analyzed: paha se ṇimmala paramapau citta sahāve suddha  /
translated: Then, with the pure, supreme, and compassionate mind, one is truly liberated.

original: parañcātmadañca ekasvabhāvaṃ na dvayarūpeṇa bhrāntiṃ kuru kintarhi sakalasattvādhātunirantarādāveva svabhāvena śuddhaḥ tadādāveva paribhāvanāyānantakamalāvṛtā
analyzed: eka svabhāvam na dvaya rūpeṇa bhrāntim kuru kintarhi sakala sattva ādhātu nirantara ādau eva svabhāvena śuddhaḥ tad ādau eva paribhāvanāya ananta kamala āvṛtā
translated: Others and oneself have one nature, not two forms through delusion. But what then? One is naturally pure in the entire realm of beings, uninterrupted, and so forth. There alone, through contemplation, one is covered by endless stains.

analyzed: na buddha ātmānam paribhāvayanti
translated: They do not consider the Buddha-self as suffering.

original: evaṃ dvayarahitena buddhaḥ saḥ nirmalaṃ paramacitaṃ svabhāvatorūpaṃ bodhicittaṃ svabhāvarahitatayā
analyzed: evam dvaya rahitena buddhaḥ saḥ nirmalam parama citam bodhi cittam svabhāva rahita tayā
translated: Thus, that Buddha, who is free from duality, the supreme, stainless mind, the enlightened mind, by its very nature, free from inherent existence,

original: addaa citta tarūaraha gau tihuvaṇe vitthāra /
analyzed: addaa citta tarūaraha gau tihuvaṇe vitthāra
translated: The mind, the best of trees, is spread out in the three worlds.

original: karūṇā phullīphala dharai ṇāu paratta ūāra / / iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Bearing the fruit of compassion, it is proclaimed as the supreme tree.

original: ukte sati paropakāraṃ sūcayati yadadvayaṃ cittaṃ yogināṃ taddharantu bhavarājaḥ /
analyzed: ukte sati para upakāram sūcayati yat advayam cittam yoginām tat harantu bhavarājaḥ
translated: When this is said, it indicates benefiting others. The non-dual mind of the yogis, may that king of existence bear.

analyzed: kalpavṛkṣam iva sarva gata tribhū vana vistāraḥ
translated: Like the wish-fulfilling tree, it is spread out everywhere in the three worlds.

analyzed: sarvam parama advayam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that everything is supreme non-duality.

analyzed: tasya karūnā puṣpa phulitena tat phullam bhavati
translated: That is blossomed with the flower of compassion. It becomes blossomed by that.

analyzed: na anena sa paropakāraḥ
translated: By this, that is not the benefit of others.

original: sarveṣāṃ sarvāsāṃ śuddhatvādi paripūrayati iti te tayā / / su
analyzed: sarveṣām sarvāsām śuddha tva ādi paripūrayati iti te tayā su
translated: It fulfills all the perfections of all, thus they are by that.

original: suṇṇa tarūvara phulliau karūṇā viviha vicitta /
analyzed: karūṇā
translated: The flower of compassion, various and variegated, is spread out on the best of trees, the void.

original: aṇṇā bhoa parattaphalu ehu sokkha paru citta /
analyzed: aṇṇā bhoa paratta phalu ehu sokkha paru citta
translated: The fruit of benefiting others is borne by that, the pure mind.

original: suṇṇa taruvara ṇikkarūṇa jahi puṇu mūla ṇa sāha /
analyzed: suṇṇa taru vara ṇikkarūṇa jahi puṇu mūla ṇa sāha
translated: The tree of compassion, void, does not have roots, nor does it have a trunk.

original: tahi ālamūla jo karai tasu paḍibhajjāi vāha / /
analyzed: tahi ālamūla jo karai
translated: He who makes it grow from the root of the mind, he is said to be the planter.

original: ekkemvī ekkevvi taru te kāraṇe phala ekka /🔽e abhiṇṇā jo muṇai so bhavaṇivvāṇa vimukka / /
analyzed: taru te kāraṇe phala  jaḥ muṇai saḥ
translated: One tree, one creeper, one fruit, one cause, one result.🔽This is well-known. He who knows this is liberated from the cycle of birth and death.

original: jo atthīaṇa ṭhīaū so jai jāi ṇirāsa /
analyzed: so
translated: If one who is born in this world goes to nirvana,

original: khaṇḍa sarāve bhikkha varū cchaḍahu e gihavāsa / /
analyzed: khaṇḍa sarāve bhikkha varū cchaḍahu e gihavāsa
translated: then, O monk, you should abandon this household life and go forth.

analyzed: pāḍayāt iti
translated: You should go forth.

original: manasi vihāya tadā sattveṣu karūṇāvantaḥ yasmādāyāti /
analyzed: manasi vihāya tadā sattveṣu karūṇāvantaḥ yasmāt āyāti
translated: Having abandoned the mind, then, being full of compassion for beings, since it comes from that,

original: yaḥ kaścidathinaḥ sa yadi nirāsaṃ yāti mayā lokena kiñcit dattam /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid athinaḥ sa yadi nirāsam yāti mayā lokena kiñcid dattam
translated: if someone who is a householder goes to nirvana, thinking I have given something to the world,

analyzed: tadā yena kiñcid siddham bhavati
translated: then by whom is anything accomplished?

original: tasmāt tvaṃ khaṇḍasarāveti bhi kṣāṃ karoṣi /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam khaṇḍasarāvā iti bhi kṣām karoṣi
translated: Therefore, you, O monk, are making a request.

analyzed: na bhoga āsaktam bhavasi
translated: You are not attached to enjoyments.

analyzed: tyajasi varam idam gṛha vāsam
translated: You are abandoning this excellent household life.

analyzed: yat thā ca uktam
translated: And as it is said:

original: para ūāra ṇa kīaū atthi ṇa dīau dāṇa /
analyzed: atthi ṇa
translated: What is done for others exists, not giving is not given.

original: ehu saṃsāre kavaṇa phalu varū cchaḍḍahu appāṇa / / iti /
analyzed: ehu saṃsāre kavaṇa phalu varū cchaḍḍahu appāṇa   iti
translated: Come, in the world, what is the excellent fruit? Abandon yourself.

original: kintena bhogena gṛheṇa vā kriyate yataḥ paropakāraṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: kim tena bhogena gṛheṇa vā kriyate yatas para upakāram na bhavati
translated: What is done by that enjoyment or household life from which there is no benefit for others?

analyzed: asti ṇa ādi vastu dānam na dīyate
translated: What is done for others exists, not giving is not given.

original: tacca tena dhanena evam idaṃ saṃsāre sthitatvāt kiṃ phalaṃ bhavati na bhavati yāvad varamidam ātmānaṃ tyajāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat ca tena dhanena evam idam saṃsāre sthita tvāt kim phalam bhavati na bhavati yāvat varam idam ātmānam tyajāmaḥ
translated: And since that is established in this world by that wealth, what fruit does it become? It does not become. It is better that we abandon this self.

analyzed: kāya jīvita nirapekṣe na vihariṣyāmi iti
translated: I will not live without regard for the body and life.

analyzed: samāptā iyam dihākoṣasya pañjikā
translated: This commentary on the Treasury of Abhidharma is complete.

analyzed: doahāḥ abhibhraṣṭa vacanasya iti
translated: It is the speech of Doha, which has been transmitted.

analyzed: tena idam koṣitā ācchāditā tattvam
translated: Therefore, this is the hidden truth, which has been concealed.

analyzed: bāla janeṣu vismayīkṛtam iti
translated: It has been made astonishing to foolish people.

analyzed: kṛtvā ca iyam mayā asya
translated: And this has been done by me.
This commentary is called Atmabodhini.

analyzed: nāmnā api sā ātmavedhī ca guru āmnāya prakāśinī
translated: It is also called Atmavedhin by name, and it reveals the teachings of the guru.

analyzed: anyān kuru
translated: And having seen others, you should also practice.

original: svārthaṃ vāpi parārthaṃ vā sādhitaṃ me śubhaṃ yataḥ /
analyzed: sva artham vā api para artham vā sādhitam me śubham yatas
translated: Since I have accomplished virtue either for my own sake or for the sake of others,

analyzed: tena puṇyena jñāna bhūmiḥ svayambhuvaḥ
translated: by that merit may the world be the ground of knowledge of the Self-Existent One.

analyzed: samāptā iyam dohā koṣasya pañjikā
translated: This commentary on the Treasury of Abhidharma is complete.

analyzed: grantha pramāṇam aṣṭaśatam asya
translated: The length of this text is eight hundred.

analyzed: kṛtiḥ iyam śrī advaya vajrapādānām iti
translated: This is the work of the venerable Advaita Vajrapada.
